page.title: 06FARMING AROUND STANFORD
page.content: The belt of land between Stanford and the refineries is occupied by 2 farms, Old Hall Farm and Oak Farm. Their activities are strongly influenced by the nature of the land. Close to the river is marshland, waterlogged during winter. At a slightly higher elevation is the 'topland', Grade 2 Agricultural land, overlying gravel and clay. Old Hall Farm uses its large area of marshland as summer pasture for Beef cattle, growing crops such as wheat and barley on the more easily cultivated 'topland'.The cattle are stall-fed in winter. Oak Farm, with no marshland is totally arable.Out of an area of 250 acres, the farmer grows about 160 acres of wheat and barley, 70 acres of assorted vegetables and 20 acres of potatoes.
